Introduction to Creative Learning

This week includes an introduction to the course, a discussion of the Lifelong Kindergarten approach, and an opportunity to share a childhood object

Watch & Read

Introduction to Creative Learning

In this video, Mitch Resnick introduces the core ideas of creative learning and how those ideas are inspired by the way children learn in kindergarten.

Subtitles are available in multiple languages.

Readings

Learn more about the big ideas of creative learning including the four P's and the creative learning spiral.

Lifelong Kindergarten - Chapter 1 (excerpts)

Also available in these languages: Italiano (Italian) , עברית (Hebrew) , 日本語 (Japanese)

Make & Share

Childhood Object

This week we invite you to share a childhood object with the community. In this video, Lily and Shruti explain a little bit more.

Subtitles are available in multiple languages.

Here are the steps for this activity

  1. Read Seymour Papert’s essay on Gears of My Childhood
    also available in Italiano (Italian), 日本語 (Japanese), Português (Portuguese), Español (Spanish)
  2. Think about an object from your childhood that interested and influenced you
  3. Go to the discussion forum to see other people’s objects
  4. Share a photo and short description of your childhood object:

Share Your Object

Reflect & Discuss

Choose one (or more) of the prompts and share your thoughts with others. You can do it in the discussion forum and/or talk with your friends and colleagues in person if you are hosting a local meet-up.

Here are some ideas:

  • Play with the P’s - Which one is your favorite P and why? (Don’t take this questions too seriously, we know all of them are important!)

  • Lifelong Kindergarten approach - Imagine if your learning environment was more similar to a kindergarten. What would be exciting? What would you be worried about?

  • Quotes - Share a quote from one of this week’s readings (or video) that particularly resonated with you. Why did you choose it?

Share Your Thoughts

Meet & Chat

Would you like to meet the LCL team and the rest of the community? We are hosting two video calls on Tuesday October 24th - one at 9am EST and another one at 4pm EST.

We’d love to see you there!
